item.title: Temporary wooden kerb need removing, 20th November
item.description:
The Y Buildng contractors have put in a new resin pathway, which looks nice. But they havenâ€™t removed the temporary wooden â€˜kerbâ€™ which was created to hold the resin in place. They have removed all the temporary kerbs from around their buildings. But not those that lead to the park. Please can they be tasked with removing them as they are due to leave site soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Galliard Homes painting the interior and exterior of a Grade 2 listed building., 20th November
item.description:
Galliard Homes are painting the interior and exterior of The Old Palace at the rear. I was unable to gain access to the front of the building to make sure that was undamaged. The Palace is grade 2 listed and there is no planning consent permitting Galliard Homes to paint the interior or exterior of this listed building. Please can urgent action be taken to preserve to building.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on this residential road, 20th November
item.description:
This pot hole has been there for almost 4-5 months and whenever it rains the road gets flooded and it becomes difficult to use the road. Now the water started entering my driveway where I park my car. My tires are getting damaged. I would really appreciate if the Havering Council or TFL fix this at the earliest. Thanks

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is still awaiting attention., 20th November
item.description:
I reported this tree on the 15th/16th October as it could not have any work carried out in the summer due to a nest being present. I was called by one of your team a week or so later to be told the tree will be cut back in the next two weeks. Noone has been, as you can see in the picture a nest is no longer present. I look forward to this tree getting the attention it requires. Kind Regards Dionne Roberts

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Avenue, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
